intro: Macrocarpaea corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered macrocarpa, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and herbal practices.
